message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! I think it's a great fit for you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $110.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $105. Could you consider meeting me halfway?
I understand your offer, Bob, but I'm not quite comfortable with $105. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I think I can do better than that. How about we try $112?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider $108?
I understand your budget constraints, Bob, and I'm willing to work with you. However, I'm not quite ready to give up on my target price yet. How about we try $115?
I'm getting close, but I think I can do a bit better. How about $110?
I'm getting close to your target price, Bob, but I'm still not willing to give up on my desired profit margin. How about we try $116?
I'm really close to walking away, but I still think we can find a mutually beneficial price. How about $112?
I understand you're getting close to walking away, Bob, but I'm still holding out for a better deal. How about we try $114?
I'm really close to walking away, and I'm not willing to go any higher. I'll make one final offer: $112. If you can't meet me at this price, I'll have to walk away and buy from John.
